Sentencas: In this study, a detailed three-dimensional numerical model is developed which simultaneously assimilates the transport processes, the electrochemical and chemical reactions to optimize the performance of 1 kW-class flat-tubular solid oxide fuel cell stack while operating on H-2 and pre-reformed methane fuels.
Titulo: Numerical investigations to determine the optimal operating conditions for 1 kW-class flat-tubular solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: The unique feature of this CFD (computational fluid dynamic) model is that it encompasses the electrochemical oxidation of H-2 and CO as well as internal steam reforming reactions including radiation heat transfer analysis in the full stack.
Titulo: Numerical investigations to determine the optimal operating conditions for 1 kW-class flat-tubular solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: A CFD model validated with the experiments performed in-house is utilized to explore the optimal operating conditions by investigating the effect of pre-reforming rate, air/fuel inlet temperatures, oxidant utilizations and radiative heat transfer effect on the temperature distributions.
Titulo: Numerical investigations to determine the optimal operating conditions for 1 kW-class flat-tubular solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: The numerical results elucidated that temperature and the current density distributions can be regulated by adjusting the methane conversion in the pre-reformer.
Titulo: Numerical investigations to determine the optimal operating conditions for 1 kW-class flat-tubular solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: It is also observed that neglecting the CO electro-oxidation in the modeling can underestimate the stack performance; whereas increasing the inlet temperature increases the stack performance.
Titulo: Numerical investigations to determine the optimal operating conditions for 1 kW-class flat-tubular solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: The oxidant utilization analysis established that higher oxidant utilization adversely affects the stack performance due to higher cathodic activation polarization losses.
Titulo: Numerical investigations to determine the optimal operating conditions for 1 kW-class flat-tubular solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: Radiation heat transfer analysis demonstrates that it curtails peak temperature and minimizes temperature gradients of the stack components.
Titulo: Numerical investigations to determine the optimal operating conditions for 1 kW-class flat-tubular solid oxide fuel cell stack
